info.name: Embloy-Integrations Collection
info.description: Contains all third-party integrations currently supporting Embloy.

item.name: Lever

query.description: The client application id as provided when registering the application with Lever.
The redirect URI must exactly match the value that the application was registered with.
Indicates which OAuth 2.0 flow you want to perform. Specify code for Authorization Code Grant Flow.

A unique token to maintain application state between the request and callback. This parameter and token value will be included in the Lever's redirect response. Embloy verifies that the token returned matches the token that you have specified. Lever recommends that this token be generated using a high-quality random-number generator.
The unique identifier of the target API.
A list of permissions that your application requires. Permissions are separated by a space character. Include offline_access to get a Refresh Token. See here for full list and description.
Specify consent to require user consent.
The unique token that Embloy specified in the original request. Embloy verifies that this token matches what was specified before continuing to the next step.
A one-time authorization code that is exchanged for an access token in the next step.

query.value: User did not authorize the request

query.description: The unique token that Embloy specified in the original request. Embloy verifies that this token matches what was specified before continuing to the next step.
A one-time authorization code that is exchanged for an access token in the next step.

query.value: User did not authorize the request

query.description: This parameter is used to return internal or external custom application questions. If unspecified, it returns both (internal and external).

response.name: 200 OK

query.description: This parameter is used to return internal or external custom application questions. If unspecified, it returns both (internal and external).
